title: Church and State Relations in Pinochet's Chile 1980-1990
abstractText: This research project explores the religion and politics in Chile during the second period of the Pinochet regime, a period that started the approval of the new Chilean Constitution in 1980, and ended with the election of Patricio Aylwin as president of Chile. During this period of Chilean history there was a general repression of civil liberties that coincided with a period of general and organised public protest against the military government. This is the first chronological reconstruction of the period in the English language, and it explores previously unpublished primary sources from ecclesiastical archives and privately printed materials.
